semantic_identifier: Impact--Add positioning change log with versioning and timestamps.docx

hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Add positioning change log with versioning and timestamps.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds an immutable, versioned audit log for all positioning recommendations—value props, differentiators, proof points, and objections—so every change is recorded with who made it, what changed, when it changed, and which segment/ICP it applies to. Each edit is stored as a new version rather than overwriting prior content, creating a complete, tamper-resistant history of our positioning over time.

By introducing stable version IDs and effective timestamps, we’ll be able to precisely reference “the positioning that was live” at any point in time. This reduces ambiguity in cross-functional workflows (Product Marketing, Sales, CS) and improves operational safety by making it easy to review prior iterations, understand decision context, and revert by re-promoting a previous version when needed.

We will also expose a read-only history endpoint that enables internal tooling and analytics to access the change log without risking mutation. This endpoint becomes the canonical source for change attribution, enabling downstream systems (dashboards, experiment analysis, CRM notes, enablement content tracking) to reference specific positioning versions consistently.

The primary impact is unlocking reliable attribution: correlating outcomes (win rate, conversion, pipeline quality, objection frequency) to the exact positioning version used for a given segment/ICP at a given time. In the near term, success is measured by completeness and correctness of the audit trail (100% of edits captured with actor/segment/timestamp/version), and by teams being able to answer “what changed and why” and “what positioning was active when this result occurred” without manual reconstruction.
